an1.485:1.1.en: They develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Buddha …

an6.10:2.9.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno buddhānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #1
an6.10:2.9.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Buddha.

an6.10:3.8.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno dhammānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #2
an6.10:3.8.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the teaching.

an6.10:4.8.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno saṅghānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #3
an6.10:4.8.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Saṅgha.

an6.10:5.7.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno sīlānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #4
an6.10:5.7.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m ethics.

an6.10:6.9.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno cāgānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #5
an6.10:6.9.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m generosity.

an6.10:7.13.pli: ‘ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṁ samāpanno devatānussatiṁ bhāveti’. #6
an6.10:7.13.en: a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and develop [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the deities.

an11.11:3.16.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno buddhānussatiṁ bhāveti.
an11.11:3.16.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Buddha.

an11.11:4.7.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno dhammānussatiṁ bhāveti.
an11.11:4.7.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the teaching.

an11.11:5.7.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno saṅghānussatiṁ bhāveti.
an11.11:5.7.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Saṅgha.

an11.11:6.6.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno sīlānussatiṁ bhāveti.
an11.11:6.6.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m their ethical conduct.

an11.11:7.8.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno cāgānussatiṁ bhāveti.
an11.11:7.8.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m generosity.

an11.11:8.12.pli: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno devatānussatiṁ bhāvetī”ti.
an11.11:8.12.en: This is called a noble disciple who lives in balance among people who are unbalanced, and lives untroubled among people who are troubled. They’ve entered the stream of the teaching and developed [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the deities.”

dn33:1.10.142.pli: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṁ vijjā, sattānaṁ cutūpapāteñāṇaṁ vijjā, āsavānaṁ khayeñāṇaṁ vijjā. #58
dn33:1.10.142.en: recollection of past lives, knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings, and knowledge of the ending of defilements.

dn33:2.2.115.pli: buddhānussati, dhammānussati, saṅghānussati, sīlānussati, cāgānussati, devatānussati. #19
dn33:2.2.115.en: [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.

dn33:2.3.50.pli: uppannuppannānaṁ adhikaraṇānaṁ samathāya vūpasamāya sammukhāvinayo dātabbo, sativinayo dātabbo, amūḷhavinayo dātabbo, paṭiññāya kāretabbaṁ, yebhuyyasikā, tassapāpiyasikā, tiṇavatthārako. #14
dn33:2.3.50.en: Removal in the presence of those concerned is applicable. Removal by accurate recollection is applicable. Removal due to recovery from madness is applicable. The acknowledgement of the offense is applicable. The decision of a majority is applicable. A verdict of aggravated misconduct is applicable. Covering over with grass is applicable.

an6.64:10.1.pli: Tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṁ pubbenivāsānussatiṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇena upasaṅkamitvā pañhaṁ pucchanti.
an6.64:10.1.en: If others come to the Realized One and ask questions about his true knowledge of recollection of past lives,

an6.64:13.4.pli: Yampidaṁ pubbenivāsānussatiṁ yathābhūtaṁ ñāṇaṁ tampi samāhitassa vadāmi no asamāhitassa.
an6.64:13.4.en: And true knowledge of [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m past lives is for those with immersion, not for those without immersion.

dn34:1.4.39.pli: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṁ vijjā, sattānaṁ cutūpapāte ñāṇaṁ vijjā, āsavānaṁ khaye ñāṇaṁ vijjā.
dn34:1.4.39.en: recollection of past lives, knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings, and knowledge of the ending of defilements.

dn34:1.7.15.pli: buddhānussati, dhammānussati, saṅghānussati, sīlānussati, cāgānussati, devatānussati.
dn34:1.7.15.en: [38;5;121mthe recollection of[0m the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.

an6.141:1.3.en: [38;5;121mThe recollection of[0m the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.

an6.9:1.3.en: [38;5;121mThe recollection of[0m the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.
